ch.nolix.core.fileSystem

Class FileSystemAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.nolix.core.fileSystem.FileSystemAccessor

  • public final class FileSystemAccessor
extends java.lang.Object
    A file system accessor can access the file system on the local machine.
    Author:
    Silvan Wyss

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileSystemAccessor()
      Creates a new file system accessor.
      FileSystemAccessor(java.lang.String rootFolderPath)
      Creates a new file system accessor with the root folder with the given root folder path.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileSystemAccessor

        public FileSystemAccessor()
        Creates a new file system accessor.

      • FileSystemAccessor

        public FileSystemAccessor(java.lang.String rootFolderPath)
        Creates a new file system accessor with the root folder with the given root folder path.
        Parameters:
        rootFolderPath -
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if there does not exist a folder with the given root folder path in the file system on the local machine.

    • Method Detail

      • accessFolderOfRunningJar

        public static FolderAccessor accessFolderOfRunningJar()
        Returns:
        a new folder accessor to the folder of the running jar.

      • getFolderPathOfRunningJar

        public static java.lang.String getFolderPathOfRunningJar()
        Returns:
        the folder path of the running jar file.

      • openFolderOfRunningJarInExplorer

        public static void openFolderOfRunningJarInExplorer()
        Opens the folder of the running jar in a new file explorer.

      • createFile

        public FileAccessor createFile(java.lang.String relativeFilePath)
        Creates a new empty file in the file system on the local machine. The file path will be the entry path of the current FileSystemAccessor followed by the given relative file path.
        Parameters:
        relativeFilePath -
        Returns:
        a new FileAccessor to the created file.
        Throws:
        NullArgumentException - if the given relative file path is null.
        EmptyArgumentException - if the given relative file path is empty.
        InvalidArgumentException - if the computed file path exists already.

      • createFile

        public FileAccessor createFile(java.lang.String relativeFilePath,
                               boolean overwrite)
        Creates a new empty file on the local machine. The file path will be the entry path of the current FileSystemAccessor followed by the given relative file path. If the given overwrite flag is true, a file with the computed file path, that exists already, will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        relativeFilePath -
        overwrite -
        Returns:
        a new FileAccessor to the created file.
        Throws:
        NullArgumentException - if the given relative file path is null.
        EmptyArgumentException - if the given relative file path is empty.
        InvalidArgumentException - if the given overwrite flag is false and the computed file path exists already.

      • createFile

        public FileAccessor createFile(java.lang.String relativeFilePath,
                               boolean overwrite,
                               java.lang.String content)
        Creates a file on the local machine. The file path will be the entry path of the current FileSystemAccessor followed by the given relative file path. The file will have the given content. If the given overwrite flag is true, a file with the computed file path, that exists already, will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        relativeFilePath -
        overwrite -
        Returns:
        a new FileAccessor to the created file.
        Throws:
        NullArgumentException - if the given relative file path is null.
        EmptyArgumentException - if the given relative file path is empty.
        InvalidArgumentException - if the given overwrite flag is false and the computed file path exists already.

      • createFile

        public FileAccessor createFile(java.lang.String relativeFilePath,
                               java.lang.String content)
        Creates a file on the local machine. The file path will be the entry path of the current FileSystemAccessor followed by the given relative file path. The file will have the given content.
        Parameters:
        relativeFilePath -
        overwrite -
        Returns:
        a new FileAccessor to the created file.
        Throws:
        NullArgumentException - if the given relative file path is null.
        EmptyArgumentException - if the given relative file path is empty.
        InvalidArgumentException - if the computed file path exists already.

      • createFileIncrementingFileName

        public FileAccessor createFileIncrementingFileName(java.lang.String relativeFilePath)
        Creates a new empty file with the given relative file path in the file system on the local machine. Increments the file name if a file system item with the given relative file path exists already in the file system on the local machine.
        Parameters:
        relativeFilePath -
        Returns:
        file accessor to the created file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an error occurs.

      • createFileIncrementingFileName

        public void createFileIncrementingFileName(java.lang.String relativeFilePath,
                                           java.lang.String content)
        Creates a new file with the given relative file path in the file system on the local machine. Writes the given content to the created file. Increments the file name if a file system item with the given relative file path exists already in the file system on the local machine.
        Parameters:
        relativeFilePath -
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an error occurs.

      • createFolder

        public FolderAccessor createFolder(java.lang.String relativeFolderPath)
        Creates a new empty folder with the given relative folder path in the file system on the local machine.
        Parameters:
        relativeFolderPath -
        Returns:
        new folder accessor to the created folder.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if a file system item with the given relative folder path exists already in the file system on the local machine.

      • deleteFileSystemItem

        public void deleteFileSystemItem(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Deletes the file system item with the given relative path from the file system on the local machine if it exists.
        Parameters:
        relativePath -

      • fileSystemItemExists

        public boolean fileSystemItemExists(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Parameters:
        relativePath -
        Returns:
        true if a file system item with given relative path exists in the file system on the local machine.

      • fileSystemItemIsFile

        public boolean fileSystemItemIsFile(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Parameters:
        relativePath -
        Returns:
        true if the file system item with the given relative path is a file in the file system on the local machine.

      • fileSystemItemIsFolder

        public boolean fileSystemItemIsFolder(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Parameters:
        relativePath -
        Returns:
        true if the file system item with the given path exists in the file system on the local machine.
